attributes.title: Cafe Bustelo
attributes.description: My hypothesis on the production and distribution of Cuban Coffee- Cafe Bustelo.
The makers of Cafe Bustelo were purchased by the Smucker’s Jam folks for $260 million in cash.
attributes.title: SMUCKER'S Inc.

attributes.description: Cafe Bustelo has its biggest coffee sales here at the Gansevoort Hotel in Miami, Florida.
attributes.title: Rowland Coffee Roasters Inc.

attributes.description:
The estimated production of coffee in Brazil is about 54,500,000 bags. About one third of all the coffee produced in the world is attributed to Brazil and the more cherishing thing for Brazilians is that they have maintained this top position for around 150 years.

Because Brazil is such a huge producer of coffee beans--thousands of people in those rural farm areas would lose their jobs as coffee bean farmers if any natural destruction occured at this end of the equator because a lot of harm could happen to their crops, and if that were the case-- they would have to up the prices on their coffee beans in the USA. 

Why I chose Brazil: "Although Colombian coffee is maybe more famous, Brazilian coffee is used in the blend of most notables coffee brands in the world." - Wikipedia
attributes.title: Brazil Coffee Beans
Brazil Coffee Beans to Rowland Coffee Roasters Inc.
Rowland Coffee Roasters Inc. to SMUCKER'S Inc.
